text: "When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance."

author: Douglas Coupland
text: "And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened."

author: Judith McNaught
text: "There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it."

author: Anais Nin
text: "I hate men who are afraid of women's strength."

author: Rodney Dangerfield
text: "What a kid I got, I told him about the birds and the bees and he told me about the butcher and my wife."

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: "Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you."

author: Mahmoud Darwish
text: "في داخلي شُرْفَةٌ

author: Elizabeth Gilbert
text: "Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions."

author: Curtis Sittenfeld
text: "I always worried someone would notice me, and then when no one did, I felt lonely."

author: Jeanette Winterson
text: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind."

author: Ingmar Bergman
text: "Only someone who is well prepared has the opportunity to improvise."

author: Susan Polis Schutz
text: "Love is . . . Being happy for the other person when they are happy, Being sad for the person when they are sad, Being together in good times, And being together in bad times.

author: George R.R. Martin
text: "Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it."

author: Albert Camus
text: "Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken."

author: Toni Morrison
text: "You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself."

author: أحمد خالد توفيق
text: "أسوء تعذيب فى العالم هو الشخص المُصر على الكلام بينما أنت مُثقل بالهموم , ترغب فى أن تبقى صامتاً وأن تصغى لأفكارك."

author: Armistead Maupin
text: "Laugh all you want and cry all you want and whistle at pretty men in the street and to hell with anybody who thinks you're a damned fool!"

author: John Green
text: "I just did some calculations and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit."

author: George Bernard Shaw
text: "Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything."

author: C. JoyBell C.
text: "There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you."

author: Plato
text: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men."

author: Alexander McCall Smith
text: "You can go through life and make new friends every year - every month practically - but there was never any substitute for those friendships of childhood that survive into adult years. Those are the ones in which we are bound to one another with hoops of steel."

author: Jane Austen
text: "It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do."

author: Alfred Tennyson
text: "I am a part of all that I have met."

author: Tim O'Brien
text: "That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth."

author: Neil Gaiman
text: "Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world."

author: Simone de Beauvoir
text: "She was ready to deny the existence of space and time rather than admit that love might not be eternal."

author: Stephenie Meyer
text: "The bond forged between us was not one that could be broken by absence, distance, or time. And no matter how much more special or beautiful or brilliant or perfect than me he might be, he was as irreversibly altered as I was. As I would always belong to him, so would he always be mine."

author: Lloyd Alexander
text: "Child, child, do you not see? For each of us comes a time when we must be more than what we are."

author: C. JoyBell C.
text: "The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think."

author: Napoléon Bonaparte
text: "Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength."

author: Horton Foote
text: "I've known people that the world has thrown everything at to discourage them...to break their spirit. And yet something about them retains a dignity. They face life and don't ask quarters."

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: "Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful."

author: J.K. Rowling
text: "To hurt is as human as to breathe."

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
text: "Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it."

author: Stephen Chbosky
text: "Just tell me how to be different in a way that makes sense."

author: Lemony Snicket
text: "It is always sad when someone leaves home, unless they are simply going around the corner and will return in a few minutes with ice-cream sandwiches."

author: John Green
text: "I found myself thinking about President William McKinley, the third American president to be assassinated. He lived for several days after he was shot, and towards the end, his wife started crying and screaming, "I want to go too! I want to go too!" And with his last measure of strength, McKinley turned to her and spoke his last words: "We are all going."

author: Albert Einstein
text: "Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding."

author: Harvey Pekar
text: "Ordinary life is pretty complex stuff."

author: Gautama Buddha
text: "There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills."

author: Nicholas Sparks
text: "Every couple needs to argue now and then. Just to prove that the relationship is strong enough to survive. Long-term relationships, the ones that matter, are all about weathering the peaks and the valleys."

author: Richelle Mead
text: "Dimitri: "Why did you come here?"

author: Lorraine Hansberry
text: "Never be afraid to sit awhile and think."

author: Marcel Proust
text: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes."

author: Kahlil Gibran
text: "لا تجالس أنصاف العشاق، ولا تصادق أنصاف الأصدقاء، لا تقرأ لأنصاف الموهوبين،لا تعش نصف حياة، ولا تمت نصف موت،لا تختر نصف حل، ولا تقف في منتصف الحقيقة، لا تحلم نصف حلم، ولا تتعلق بنصف أمل، إذا صمتّ.. فاصمت حتى النهاية، وإذا تكلمت.. فتكلّم حتى النهاية، لا تصمت كي تتكلم، ولا تتكلم كي تصمت.

author: Cormac McCarthy
text: "You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget."

author: Walt Disney Company
text: "The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. "

author: J.K. Rowling
text: "Where is Wood?" said Harry, suddenly realizing he wasn't there.

author: Cassandra Clare
text: "I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-"

author: Bruce Lee
text: "I'm not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine."

author: Gabriel García Márquez
text: "He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves."

author: Nora Roberts
text: "If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place."

author: Chris Abani
text: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion."

author: Suzanne Collins
text: "Kind people have a way of working their way inside me and rooting there."

author: Stephen Fry
text: "If you know someone who's depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isn't a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.

author: Kate Mosse
text: "We are who we are, be­cause of those we choose to love and be­cause of those who love us."

author: Taylor Swift
text: "Your lucky enough to be different, never change"

author: Amos Bronson Alcott
text: "Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary."

author: Chelsea Handler
text: "Laugh loudly, laugh often, and most important, laugh at yourself."

author: Walt Whitman
text: "Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you."

author: Ayn Rand
text: "Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing."

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: "The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated."

author: Ned Vizzini
text: "I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?"

author: Jonathan Safran Foer
text: "There were things I wanted to tell him. But I knew they would hurt him. So I buried them, and let them hurt me."

author: Cassandra Clare
text: "Is there some particular reason that you're here?" ...

author: Albert Einstein
text: "In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity"

author: Charles Dickens
text: "It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known."

author: Susan Faludi
text: "When the enemy has no face, society will invent one."

author: Herman Melville
text: "I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing."

author: Cassandra Clare
text: "I forgot that's what gets you all hot and bothered, Jace, girls killing things."

author: Dante Alighieri
text: "Do not be afraid; our fate

author: J.K. Rowling
text: "From now on, I don't care if my tea leaves spell 'Die, Ron, Die,' I'm chucking them in the bin where they belong."

author: Amelia Earhart
text: "Adventure is worthwhile in itself."

author: Charles M. Schulz
text: "Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'.

author: Anais Nin
text: "Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country."

author: L.M. Montgomery
text: "I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers."

author: Cassandra Clare
text: "So you're a Shadowhunter,' Nate said. 'De Quincey told me that you lot were monsters.'

author: Henry Adams
text: "Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit."

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: "It is not the length of life, but the depth."

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: "Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them."

author: Neil Gaiman
text: "Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit."

author: Mother Teresa
text: "If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other."

author: Tami Hoag
text: "We never know the quality of someone else's life, though we seldom resist the temptation to assume and pass judgement."

author: Rick Riordan
text: "He cleared his throat and held up one hand dramatically.

author: George Carlin
text: "The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live."

author: H.M. Harwood
text: "Men marry women with the hope they will never change. Women marry men with the hope they will change. Invariably they are both disappointed."

author: Charlotte Brontë
text: "Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation."

author: Leo Tolstoy
text: "If you want to be happy, be."

author: G.K. Chesterton
text: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity."

author: Lemony Snicket
text: "The sad truth is the truth is sad."

author: Anna Akhmatova
text: "If you were music, I would listen to you ceaselessly, and my low spirits would brighten up."

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: "The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time."

author: Masashi Kishimoto
text: "She's strong! And scary...I bet she's single...I'd put money on it.."

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: "The earth laughs in flowers."

author: Maya Angelou
text: "The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise."

author: Sophie Kinsella
text: "sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!"

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: "Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true."

author: David Levithan
text: "livid,

author: Oscar Wilde
text: "Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them."

author: Stephen Chbosky
text: "I just want you to know that you're very special... and the only reason I'm telling you is that I don't know if anyone else ever has."

author: Terry Pratchett
text: "Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind."

author: Audrey Niffenegger
text: "I won't ever leave you, even though you're always leaving me."

author: Elizabeth Gilbert
text: "The Bhagavad Gita--that ancient Indian Yogic text--says that it is better to live your own destiny imperfectly than to live an imitation of somebody else's life with perfection."

author: Jonathan Kellerman
text: "Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass."

author: Matt Groening
text: "I know all those words, but that sentence makes no sense to me."

author: Shel Silverstein
text: "The Voice

author: Robert Frost
text: "Poetry is what gets lost in translation."

author: William Shakespeare
text: "Lord, what fools these mortals be!"

author: Sue Grafton
text: "Ideas are easy. It's the execution of ideas that really separates the sheep from the goats."

author: Dr. Seuss
text: "I'm glad we had the times together just to laugh and sing a song, seems like we just got started and then before you know it, the times we had together were gone."

author: Judith Viorst
text: "Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces."

author: Jalaluddin Rumi
text: "Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along."

author: Oscar Wilde
text: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about."

author: Gertrude Stein
text: "It takes a lot of time to be a genius. You have to sit around so much, doing nothing, really doing nothing."

author: Gilles Deleuze
text: "A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window."

author: Albert Einstein
text: "The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives."

author: Ira Glass
text: "Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it's just not that good. It's trying to be good, it has potential, but it's not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn't have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I've ever met. It's gonna take awhile. It's normal to take awhile. You've just gotta fight your way through."

author: Francis Bacon
text: "If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties."

author: David T.W. McCord
text: "Books fall open, you fall in."

author: John Green
text: "That didn't happen, of course. Things never happened the way I imagined them."

author: Confucius
text: "He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions."

author: John Banville
text: "The past beats inside me like a second heart."

author: Anais Nin
text: "There were always in me, two women at least, one woman desperate and bewildered, who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene, as upon a stage, conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses, helplessness, despair, and present to the world only a smile, an eagerness, curiosity, enthusiasm, interest."

author: Suzanne Collins
text: "Sometimes when I'm alone, I take the pearl from where it lives in my pocket and try to remember the boy with the bread, the strong arms that warded off nightmares on the train, the kisses in the arena."

author: Eoin Colfer
text: "I never tell anyone exactly how clever I am. They would be too scared."

author: Amy Sedaris
text: "I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone."

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: "No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful."

author: George R.R. Martin
text: "The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that."

author: Dennis Lehane
text: "There's something ugly about the flawless."

author: Gore Vidal
text: "How marvelous books are, crossing worlds and centuries, defeating ignorance and, finally, cruel time itself."

author: James Branch Cabell
text: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true."

author: A.A. Milne
text: "I used to believe in forever, but forever's too good to be true"

author: Mae West
text: "I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure."

author: Robert Frost
text: "Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it."

author: E.L. James
text: "You have to kiss a lot of frogs before you find your prince"

author: Roy T. Bennett
text: "We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead."

author: A.A. Milne
text: "I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost."

author: Bram Stoker
text: "Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!"

author: Jack Kerouac
text: "My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them."

author: Vladimir Nabokov
text: "Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth."

author: Jude Deveraux
text: "Love can make even nice people do awful things."

author: E.L. James
text: "This is me, Ana. All of me...and I'm all yours. What do I have to do to make you realize that? To make you see that I want you any way I can get you. That I love you."

author: Stephanie Perkins
text: "I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul."

author: Paulo Coelho
text: "None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have Faith."

author: George Washington
text: "It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one."

author: Lemony Snicket
text: "It is difficult, when faced with a situation you cannot control, to admit you can do nothing."

author: Maya Angelou
text: "Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman."

author: George Carlin
text: "If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?"

author: Samuel Beckett
text: "We are all born mad. Some remain so."

author: Albert Einstein
text: "A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?"

author: Jojo Moyes
text: "Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE."

author: Tamora Pierce
text: "Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary."

author: Stéphane Mallarmé
text: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book."

author: Yves Saint-Laurent
text: "The most beautiful makeup of a woman is passion. But cosmetics are easier to buy."

author: Stefan Zweig
text: "Time to leave now, get out of this room, go somewhere, anywhere; sharpen this feeling of happiness and freedom, stretch your limbs, fill your eyes, be awake, wider awake, vividly awake in every sense and every pore."

author: Walter Mosley
text: "We are not trapped or locked up in these bones. No, no. We are free to change. And love changes us. And if we can love one another, we can break open the sky."

author: Galileo Galilei
text: "I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him."

author: Paulo Coelho
text: "This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you."

author: Elinor Glyn
text: "Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze. "

author: Rick Riordan
text: "Rachel: You're a half-blood, too?

author: Audrey Hepburn
text: "I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day, and I believe in miracles"

author: Albert Camus
text: "Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present."

author: Jane Austen
text: "Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way."

author: Anderson Cooper
text: "The farther you go...the harder it is to return. The world has many edges and it's easy to fall off."

author: Ted Hughes
text: "The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all."

author: Natalie Babbitt
text: "Like all magnificent things, it's very simple."

author: Edward Lear
text: "And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand,

author: E.B. White
text: "I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savor) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day."

author: Rick Riordan
text: "Hades raised an eyebrow. When he sat forward in his throne, shadowy faces appeared in the folds of his black robes, faces of torment,as if the garment was stitched of trapped souls from the Fields of Punishment, trying to get out. The ADHD part of me wondered, off-task, whether the rest of his clothes were made the same way. What horrible things would you have to do in your life to get woven into Hades' underwear?"

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: "Ok. You fuck me, then snub me. You love me, you hate me. You show me a sensitive side, then you turn into a total asshole. Is this a pretty accurate description of our relationship."

author: Coco Chanel
text: "In order to be irreplaceacle, one must always be different."

author: Stanley Fish
text: "The purpose of a good education is to show you that there are three sides to a two-sided story."

author: Mother Teresa
text: "What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family."

author: Tiffanie DeBartolo
text: "Did you really want to die?"

author: Greg Behrendt
text: "I'm about to make a wild, extreme and severe relationship rule: the word busy is a load of crap and is most often used by assholes. The word "busy" is the relationship Weapon of Mass Destruction. It seems like a good excuse, but in fact in every silo you uncover, all you're going to find is a man who didn't care enough to call. Remember men are never to busy to get what they want."

author: C.S. Lewis
text: "It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased."

author: Suzanne Collins
text: "Yes, and I'm sure the arena will be full of bags of flour for me to chuck at people."

author: J.K. Rowling
text: "Sometimes you remind me a lot of James. He called it my 'furry little problem' in company. Many people were under the impression that I owned a badly behaved rabbit."

author: Simone de Beauvoir
text: "I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself"

author: Adolf Hitler
text: "If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!"

author: Charlotte Brontë
text: "Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste."

author: Cornelia Funke
text: "If you take a book with you on a journey," Mo had said when he put the first one in her box, "an odd thing happens: The book begins collecting your memories. And forever after you have only to open that book to be back where you first read it. It will all come into your mind with the very first words: the sights you saw in that place, what it smelled like, the ice cream you ate while you were reading it... yes, books are like flypaper-memories cling to the printed page better than anything else."

author: Marcus Valerius Martialis
text: "Tomorrow's life is too late. Live today."

author: Johanna Lindsey
text: "Do for yourself, for no one else will."

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: "Dreams are the touchstones of our characters."

author: Ruth Westheimer
text: "A lesson taught with humor is a lesson retained."

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: "Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn."

author: Edith Sitwell
text: "Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home."

author: Rita Mae Brown
text: "About all you can do in life is be who you are. Some people will love you for you. Most will love you for what you can do for them, and some won't like you at all."

author: Rafael Sabatini
text: "He was born with a gift of laughter and a sense that the world was mad."

author: Cassandra Clare
text: "I have a fetish for damsels in distress."

author: Wendy Mass
text: "Do you ever think if people heard our conversations they'd lock us up?"

author: Carolyn Keene
text: "Read, read, read. That's all I can say."

author: J.K. Rowling
text: "Don't put your wand there, boy! ... Better wizards than you have lost buttocks, you know!"

author: Aristotle
text: "Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all."

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: "Parents are like God because you wanna know they're out there, and you want them to think well of you, but you really only call when you need something."

author: Aisha Tyler
text: "Wounds turn into scars and scars make you tough."

author: Edith Sitwell
text: "I am not eccentric. It's just that I am more alive than most people. I am an unpopular electric eel set in a pond of catfish."

author: Becca Fitzpatrick
text: "All this time I've hated myself for it. I thought I'd given it up for nothing. But if I hadn't fallen, I wouldn't have met you."

author: D.H. Lawrence
text: "For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack."

author: George Sand
text: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness."

author: J.K. Rowling
text: "Well, you're expelling us aren't you?" said Ron.

author: Nicholas Sparks
text: "Do you want a cookie?

author: Nadine Gordimer
text: "The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is."

author: Colm Tóibín
text: "Ending a novel is almost like putting a child to sleep-it can't be done abruptly."

author: Alice McDermott
text: "We are surrounded by story."

author: Amy Tan
text: "If you can't change your fate, change your attitude."

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
text: "I'm going to smile, and my smile will sink down into your pupils, and heaven knows what it will become."

author: John Knowles
text: "There was no harm in taking aim, even if the target was a dream."

author: Rachel Caine
text: "Perv."

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: "Just for the record, the weather today is calm and sunny, but the air is full of bullshit."

author: Roy T. Bennett
text: "Attitude is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Optimism is a choice. Kindness is a choice. Giving is a choice. Respect is a choice. Whatever choice you make makes you. Choose wisely."

author: John Green
text: "Sometimes I don't get you,' I said.
